result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on December 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Sarah St John

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan R Cruz in court.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Juan R Cruz. Interpreter St John previously sworn. Attorney is requesting trial, case needs to be assigned then set for trial with Attorney Colque. Minutes filed.
Saul Arteaga

Defendant Juan R Cruz in court with the assistance of Spanish Interpreter, Arteaga.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Juan R Cruz.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:30 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference. Record by Atty. Colque as to status and requests additional 30-45 days to go over discovery and offer that was just provided by the State. Court grants request. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
3:10 PM (64-06) Defendant Juan R Cruz appeared in court with Sara St. John, interpreter sworn by the clerk, Attorney Erik I. Colque Atty for Juan R Cruz appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.
Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Colque acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charge on behalf of his client.
Arteaga

Notice of Arrest
St. John

No posession or use of another person's personal identifications. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.G.S. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-598 & 22-599

Interpreter St. John previously sworn by Clerk. Right to attorney options form given; referred to SPD.  SPD did not have an interpreter to speak to Defendant prior to Court. Minutes filed.
